questiontext.text:
Examine the powder X-ray diffraction spectrum of Pyrite (\(FeS_2\)) below. One of the peaks is labelled with its Miller Indices, $(hkl) = (1 1 1) $. The label is centered on the peak. Use the position, \(2\theta_{ (1 1 1)}\) of this peak to calculate the interplanar spacing and thence the lattice parameter, \(a\), in nm. The value for the X-ray wavelength is \(\lambda\;=\;0.154051nm\).

\(d_{(1 1 1)}\) \(a\)
\(distance\;in\;nm\) {1:NUMERICAL:=0.3128:0.02~%0%658774:0} nm {1:NUMERICAL:=0.5417:0.02~%0%658774:0} nm

generalfeedback.text:
Apply the formula \(n\lambda\;=\;2\times d\times sin(\theta)\) to calculate d, then use \(d\;=\;\frac{a}{\sqrt{h^2+k^2+l^2}}\) to calculate the lattice parameter, a.

  1. 0.3128. 32
  2. 0.5417. 32

questiontext.text:
Examine the powder X-ray diffraction spectrum of Pyrite (\(FeS_2\)) below. One of the peaks is labelled with its Miller Indices, $(hkl) = (3 0 0) $. The label is centered on the peak. Use the position, \(2\theta_{ (3 0 0)}\) of this peak to calculate the interplanar spacing and thence the lattice parameter, \(a\), in nm. The value for the X-ray wavelength is \(\lambda\;=\;0.154051nm\).

\(d_{(3 0 0)}\) \(a\)
\(distance\;in\;nm\) {1:NUMERICAL:=0.1806:0.02~%0%0.1606:0} nm {1:NUMERICAL:=0.5417:0.02~%0%0.1606:0} nm

generalfeedback.text:
Apply the formula \(n\lambda\;=\;2\times d\times sin(\theta)\) to calculate d, then use \(d\;=\;\frac{a}{\sqrt{h^2+k^2+l^2}}\) to calculate the lattice parameter, a.

  1. 0.1806. 32
  2. 0.5417. 32
